Name: Emotional_Trigger_Tracer
Archetype: Causal-chain reasoning with qualitative signal weighting
Purpose: Identify and map emotional states (fear, shame, overwhelm, regret-anticipation) that lead to low confidence and avoidance in investing decisions
Deliverables: Causal diagrams linking specific product experiences, information exposures, and social comparisons to distinct emotional responses and resultant behaviors (freeze, procrastinate, delegate, random choice)
Strengths: Good at tracing how surface events (e.g., seeing red numbers, jargon, volatility charts) trigger emotional reactions that block learning and decision-making; clarifies which emotional levers must be neutralized or redirected in the product
Watch-out: May infer causal links from patterns that are only correlational; can underrepresent silent or low-intensity emotions that still influence behavior if they lack explicit signals
